intro: Thalictrella thalictroides, commonly known as the yellow thalictrella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, with prominent, hairy bracts. Its leaves are basal, lanceolate, and often have a waxy coating. Thalictrella thalictroides is characterized by its unique floral structure and is often found in temperate regions of North America.
